poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Leaving work, "my mind bruised with it" I thought to write, but that Is a symptom, not description, Of bruising of the spirit in bureaucracy, Confined to its ineptitudes, and one of them, As a bruise on the leg disfigures in disabling. All that adrenaline and no one to thump. All that testosterone, and who were those Darkling women with the rusty hair? Mother and child? Though in the daughter's brow The genes gave way to geometry. That tawny tawse, I could feel it in my hand - Conflation of the French toison With punishment for thinking o't. Go home.
